title: Nitro
description: Nuxt Kit provides a set of utilities to help you work with Nitro. These functions allow you to add server handlers, plugins, and prerender routes.

children.value: Nitro is an open source TypeScript framework to build ultra-fast web servers. Nuxt 3 (and, optionally, Nuxt Bridge) uses Nitro as its server engine. You can use
to add a server handler to be used only in development mode,
to add a plugin to extend Nitro's runtime behavior, and
to add routes to be prerendered by Nitro.
Adds a nitro server handler. Use it if you want to create server middleware or custom route.

props.className: language-ts shiki shiki-themes material-theme-lighter material-theme-lighter material-theme-palenight

children.value: A handler object with the following properties:
Path prefix or route. If an empty string used, will be used as a middleware.
Specifies this is a middleware handler. Middleware are called on every route and should normally return nothing to pass to the next handlers.
Use lazy loading to import handler.
Router method matcher. If handler name contains method name, it will be used as a default value.

props.className: language-ts shiki shiki-themes material-theme-lighter material-theme-lighter material-theme-palenight
language-ts shiki shiki-themes material-theme-lighter material-theme-lighter material-theme-palenight

children.value: Adds a nitro server handler to be used only in development mode. This handler will be excluded from production build.

props.className: language-ts shiki shiki-themes material-theme-lighter material-theme-lighter material-theme-palenight

children.value: A handler object with the following properties:

children.value: Changes to the Nitro instance configuration are not applied.

children.value: Using experimental payload extraction for full-static output. You can opt-out by setting `experimental.payloadExtraction` to `false`.
Add plugin to extend Nitro's runtime behavior.
You can read more about Nitro plugins in the

children.value: Path to the plugin. The plugin must export a function that accepts Nitro instance as an argument.

children.value: A route or an array of routes to prerender.

children.value: html .light .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-light);background: var(--shiki-light-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-light-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-light-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-light-text-decoration);}html.light .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-light);background: var(--shiki-light-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-light-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-light-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-light-text-decoration);}html .default .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-default);background: var(--shiki-default-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-default-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-default-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-default-text-decoration);}html .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-default);background: var(--shiki-default-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-default-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-default-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-default-text-decoration);}html .dark .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-dark);background: var(--shiki-dark-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-dark-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-dark-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-dark-text-decoration);}html.dark .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-dark);background: var(--shiki-dark-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-dark-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-dark-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-dark-text-decoration);}
